Izzy_Miller:
{{short description|American musician and former politician (born 1993)}} {{Cleanup bare URLs|date=August 2022}} {{Use American English|date=December 2017}} {{Use mdy dates|date=December 2017}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Izzy Miller | image = | caption = | image_size = 250px | landscape = | birth_name = Izzy Miller | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1993|6|22|mf=y}} | birth_place = [[Huntsville, Alabama]], U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | instrument = Guitar, vocals, bass guitar, drums, organ | genre = [[rock music|Rock]], [[country music|country]], [[indie rock|indie]], [[garage rock]],{{Cite web |url=http://paulwells.download/izzy-miller-and-the-black-market-salesmen-american-times-2017/ |title=Izzy Miller and the Black Market Salesmen – American Times (2017) |.rar Zippyshare Mediafire Torrent Download | Paul Wells |access-date=December 3, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171204222844/http://paulwells.download/izzy-miller-and-the-black-market-salesmen-american-times-2017/ |archive-date=December 4, 2017 |url-status=dead }} [[Americana (music)|Americana]],{{Cite web|url=http://www.lamusiccritic.com/indie_voice_blog/get-it-or-forget-it-izzy-miller-a-swarm-of-the-sun-hedvig-mollestad-trio-the-vegabonds-alice-wallace/|title=Get it or forget it – Izzy Miller, A Swarm of the Sun, Hedvig Mollestad Trio, the Vegabonds, Alice Wallace|date=January 19, 2019}} [[pop rock]]{{Cite web|url=https://parapop.net/izzy-miller-if-we-cant-work-it-out/|title = Izzy Miller - if We Can't Work It Out - ParaPOP|date = April 25, 2020}} | occupation = Musician | years_active = 2007–2014, 2016–present | label = Long Week Records (2010–2015)
764 Entertainment (2016)
The Standard (2017–2020)
Turtle Mountain Records (2021 - Present) | associated_acts = [[Hank Williams Jr.]], The Black Market Salesmen, [[Joey Huffman]], Storage | website = {{URL|https://www.theizzymiller.com/|Official}} }} '''Izzy Miller''' (born June 22, 1993) is an American guitarist, singer, and songwriter.{{Cite web|url=https://grungecake.com/omo-frenchie-charles-wesley-godwin/articles/50573|title=New Music Wednesdays: 10 new songs you should hear featuring Omo Frenchie and Charles Wesley Godwin – GRUNGECAKE|date=January 30, 2019 }} His first success came with his band Storage with the release of their 2009 single "Just a Little More". Miller left Storage in 2010 (with the exception of a short reunion tour in 2011) and began a solo career. After releasing ''Back From Nowhere'', his first solo album, in 2010, he paired up with drummer Smokin' Joey Gambrell. Miller and Gambrell went on to release ''Who Is That? Nobody'' in 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/who-is-that-nobody-mw0002435804|title=Who Is That? Nobody - Smokin' Joey Gambrell, Izzy Miller - Songs, Reviews, Credits - AllMusic|website=AllMusic|access-date=December 5, 2017}} He was named on [[The Birmingham News|AL.com]]'s "14 up-and-coming North [[Alabama]] bands, solo acts poised to make noise in 2014" list in 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.al.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2013/11/14_up-and-coming_north_alabama.html|title=14 up-and-coming North Alabama bands, solo acts poised to make noise in 2014 (photos)|website=al.com|date=November 20, 2013|access-date=December 5, 2017}} His 2014 album, titled ''Commercially Inept'', was produced by [[Grammy Award|Grammy]]-nominated musician [[Joey Huffman]].{{cite web|url=http://www.al.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2014/11/izzy_miller_track-by-track_hun.html|title=Izzy Miller track-by-track: Huntsville rocker goes country, asks 'What if someone was so lonesome they forgot to get drunk?'|website=al.com|date=November 4, 2014|access-date=December 5, 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/commericially-inept-mw0002842802|title=Commercially Inept - Izzy Miller - Songs, Reviews, Credits - AllMusic|website=AllMusic|access-date=December 5, 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.discogs.com/Izzy-Miller-Commercially-Inept/release/6579344|title=Izzy Miller - Commercially Inept|website=Discogs|date=November 11, 2014 |access-date=December 5, 2017}} He has shared festival stages and opened for acts such as [[Drivin N Cryin]],{{cite web|url=http://www.al.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2014/05/whistlestop_weekend_2014_gets.html|title=WhistleStop Weekend 2014 gets off to sunny and (barbecue) smoky start in downtown Huntsville|website=al.com|date=May 3, 2014|access-date=December 5, 2017}} [[John Anderson (musician)|John Anderson]],{{cite web|url=http://www.al.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2012/05/john_anderson_secret_sisters_a.html|title=John Anderson, Secret Sisters among musical highlights at WhistleStop Weekend|website=al.com|date=May 3, 2012|access-date=December 5, 2017}} and many others. He has had two entries on the [[Billboard charts#Rock|Billboard Rock Digital Songs]] chart, with 2013's "Where to Land" (number 49) and 2014's "Rapid Decline" (number 44).{{cite web|url=http://www.wlrh.org/WritersCorner/invisible-city-november-28-2014-hour-1|title=Invisible City (November 28, 2014) Hour 1|date=December 5, 2014|website=wlrh.org|access-date=December 5, 2017|archive-date=December 6, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206135855/http://www.wlrh.org/WritersCorner/invisible-city-november-28-2014-hour-1|url-status=dead}} In September 2015, Miller announced that he would run for the office of mayor in Huntsville, Alabama, in 2016.https://www.facebook.com/izzymillerhuntsville/posts/1137558142940132 {{User-generated source|certain=yes|date=March 2022}} Miller largely withdrew from the music industry after the release of ''Commercially Inept'' in 2014 and rarely appeared on stage or in interviews for nearly two years. In August 2016, he announced that he had signed with 764 Entertainment. "Back to Getting Over You", his first single for the label, was released on September 16, 2016.{{cite web|url=http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/izzymiller4|title=♫ Back to Getting over You - Izzy Miller. Listen @cdbaby|website=cdbaby.com|access-date=December 5, 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.maximumvolumemusic.com/review-izzy-miller-black-market-salesmen-american-times-2017/|title=REVIEW: IZZY MILLER AND THE BLACK MARKET SALESMEN - AMERICAN TIMES (2017) was - MaximumVolumeMusic|date=November 26, 2017|website=maximumvolumemusic.com|access-date=December 5, 2017}} Miller signed with the Standard in 2017 and began a collaboration with the Huntsville-based band the Black Market Salesmen. Their first single, "Mr. TV Man", was released on August 4, 2017.{{cite web|url=http://www.al.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2017/08/cool_things_to_do_in_huntsvill_78.html|title=Cool things to do in Huntsville, Aug. 6-12|website=al.com|date=August 6, 2017|access-date=December 5, 2017}}{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0749FPVLG|title=Mr. TV Man|publisher=|access-date=December 5, 2017|via=Amazon}} A pre-sale for the single was announced on July 28 and the song immediately reached high peaks on multiple Amazon Best Sellers lists, including peaking at number 4 on the Amazon Movers & Shakers list (receiving over a 12,000% increase in sales), #28 on the Amazon Hot New Releases list, and #49 on the Amazon Best Sellers list.{{cite web|url=https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=1787388254623781&id=164050513624238|title=Izzy Miller|website=m.facebook.com|access-date=December 5, 2017}}{{cite web|url=https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=1787465171282756&substory_index=0&id=164050513624238|title=Izzy Miller|website=m.facebook.com|access-date=December 5, 2017}} A collaboration album between Miller and the Black Market Salesmen, titled ''American Times'', was released on December 1, 2017.{{cite web|url=https://www.insertreviewhere.com/single-post/2017/09/20/Mr-TV-Man---Izzy-Miller-The-Black-Market-Salesmen|title=insertreviewhere|website=insertreviewhere|date=September 20, 2017|access-date=December 5, 2017}} The album features a guest appearance from Tawny Hillis and Joey Huffman on the track "It Just Happens I Guess".{{cite web|url=http://spiceradio.podbean.com/e/spicecast-153-izzy-miller-and-the-black-market-salesmen/|title=Spicecast #153 - Izzy Miller and the Black Market Salesmen|first=PodBean|last=Development|website=podbean.com|access-date=December 5, 2017}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.maximumvolumemusic.com/review-black-market-salesmen-brainstorm-2018/|title = Review: Black Market Salesmen - Brainstorm (2018)|date = August 17, 2018}} The title track from the album was featured in the April 2018 issue of [[Classic Rock (magazine)|''Classic Rock'']] magazine and appeared on their "Firestarters" compilation.{{Cite web|url=https://www.discogs.com/Various-Firestarters/release/11760821|title = Firestarters (2018, CD)|website = [[Discogs]]| date=September 24, 2023 }}Classic Rock Magazine, April 2018 He released ''Precipice'' on January 11, 2019.{{Cite web|url=https://genius.com/Genius-january-2019-album-release-calendar-annotated|title = Genius – January 2019 Album Release Calendar}}{{Cite web|url=https://rockthepigeon.com/2019/01/13/izzy-miller-sings-the-ballad-of-a-lonesome-cowboy/|title=Izzy Miller Sings the Ballad of a Lonesome Cowboy|date=January 14, 2019}} The record features guest appearances from Joey Huffman, Mike Daly, Shane Davis, and Ben Jobe.{{Cite news|url=http://www.maximumvolumemusic.com/review-izzy-miller-precipice-2019/|title = Review: Izzy Miller - Precipice (2019)| newspaper=Maximum Volume Music |date = November 19, 2018| last1=Thorley | first1=Andy }}{{Cite web|url=http://comeherefloyd.com/2019/01/common-ground-king-catcher-born-lion-izzy-miller-the-wit|title = (415) Common Ground // King Catcher // Born Lion // Izzy Miller // The Wit #CHF #lists #indie #indierock #indiefolk|date = January 22, 2019}}{{Cite web|url=http://bsidesbadlands.com/taste-test-edition-17/|title=Taste Test, Edition #17: Heaven Smile, Emily Chambers, MOZAÍK & more|date=January 25, 2019}} His sixth studio release, ''Life on the One and Three'', was released on April 24, 2020.{{Cite news|url=https://www.albumoftheyear.org/album/226620-izzy-miller-life-on-the-one-and-three.php|title = Izzy Miller - Life on the One and Three| newspaper=Album of the Year }} Miller is the co-founder of Turtle Mountain Records and released two singles on the label during 2021, "Home Again" and "Who Am I to Blame".{{Cite web|url=https://musicmecca.org/alabama-ace-americana-singer-songwriter-izzy-miller-releases-new-single-who-am-i-to-blame/|title = Alabama Ace: Americana Singer-Songwriter Izzy Miller Releases New Single 'Who Am I to Blame'|date = November 18, 2021}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.wewriteaboutmusic.com/reviews/izzy-miller-home-again|title = Izzy Miller delivers a soulful performance on "Home Again"| date=July 15, 2021 }} ==Career== Miller began playing guitar and singing in bands at age thirteen. In 2007, Miller became a member of Before Existence,{{cite web|url=http://spice-radio.com/2014/11/izzy-miller-at-spice-rack-studios/|title=Izzy Miller at Spice Rack Studios - Spice Radio|website=spice-radio.com|date=November 2, 2014|access-date=December 5, 2017}} which would eventually evolve into Storage. Storage released their first single, "Just a Little More", in April 2009. The single achieved heavy rotation on radio in the southeastern United States. After leaving Storage in 2010, Miller released ''Back From Nowhere'', his debut solo record.{{cite web|url=http://www.alabamamusicoffice.com/artists-a-z/m-1/2637-miller-izzy.html|title=Miller, Izzy|website=www.alabamamusicoffice.com|access-date=December 5, 2017}} Shortly after the release of ''Back From Nowhere'', Miller teamed up with drummer Smokin' Joey Gambrell.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/artists/izzy-miller/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150806201432/http://www.mtv.com/artists/izzy-miller/|url-status=dead|archive-date=August 6, 2015|title=Music – Music News, New Songs, Videos, Music Shows and Playlists from MTV|website=www.mtv.com|access-date=December 5, 2017}} Miller and Gambrell released one album together (2012's ''Who Is That? Nobody''). After the release of the record, they released one last single before they split in late 2013, titled "Where to Land". The song was released as a free download on May 21, 2013, and peaked at #49 on the Billboard Rock Digital Songs chart. "Where to Land" has been played on YouTube nearly 80,000 times since it was released.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sxhsl_GApxw|title=Where To Land - Izzy Miller & Smokin' Joey Gambrell|last=Izzy Miller|date=May 21, 2013|publisher=|access-date=December 5, 2017|via=YouTube}} Miller began work on ''Commercially Inept'' in early 2014, and it was released on November 11, 2014. The record was recorded in [[Marietta, Georgia]] and produced by [[Joey Huffman]] and Kevin Sellors. The first single from the record, "Rapid Decline", peaked at #44 on the Billboard Rock Digital Songs chart. The second single from the record, "I Forgot to Get Drunk", was released to country radio in 2015, but failed to chart. He signed with 764 Entertainment in August 2016. A single, "Back to Getting Over You," was released on September 16, 2016. It was Miller's first new release in nearly two years. The recording featured Shane Davis and Kris Poorman (both of the [[Huntsville, Alabama]]-based band the Black Market Salesmen). This would lead to a collaboration with the entire band on a single titled "Mr. TV Man" that was released in August 2017. The single was produced by Dan Bullard and Ben Jobe. Miller rarely covers material by other artists, but he did post a performance of "[[(What's So Funny 'Bout) Peace, Love, and Understanding]]" on August 14, 2017, on his official Facebook page and YouTube account in response to the violence at the [[Unite the Right rally]] in [[Charlottesville, Virginia]], a few days prior. A collaboration album between Miller and the Black Market Salesmen, titled ''American Times'', was released on December 1, 2017.{{cite web|url=https://store.cdbaby.com/cd/izzymillertheblackmarket|title=♫ American Times - Izzy Miller. Listen @cdbaby|website=cdbaby.com|access-date=December 5, 2017}} The album was met with positive reviews, with some comparing it to the sound of [[Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers]],{{cite web|url=http://www.al.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2017/12/cool_things_to_do_in_huntsvill_94.html|title=Cool things to do in Huntsville, Dec. 3-9|website=al.com|date=December 3, 2017|access-date=December 5, 2017}} [[Marah (band)|Marah]], and [[Steve Earle]]. Miller released ''Precipice'' on January 11, 2019. He revealed in the liner notes for the EP that it was inspired by an (then) girlfriend leaving him for her ex.{{Cite web|url=https://store.cdbaby.com/cd/izzymiller6|title=CD Baby Music Store}} The EP has been called "uncomfortable, but incredible, listening"{{Cite news|url=http://www.maximumvolumemusic.com/review-izzy-miller-precipice-2019/|title = Review: Izzy Miller - Precipice (2019)| newspaper=Maximum Volume Music |date = November 19, 2018| last1=Thorley | first1=Andy }} as well as the leading single, "Another Drink or Two", being called "the perfect portrayal of the loss of love and a haunting feeling of loneliness".{{Cite web|url=https://modernmusicmaker.com/music-reviews/mick-mullin-native-harrow-izzy-miller|title=* Mick Mullin * Native Harrow * Izzy Miller|date=January 23, 2019}}{{Dead link|date=September 2024 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} His sixth studio release, "Life on the One and Three", was released on April 24, 2020. Two singles, "If We Can't Work It Out" and "One More Day", were released from the album.{{cite web | url=https://www.caesarlivenloud.com/2020/04/izzy-miller-shares-new-single-one-more-day.html | title=Izzy Miller Shares New Single 'One More Day' | date=April 24, 2020 }} The record has been described as "timeless brilliance".{{Cite web|url=http://www.maximumvolumemusic.com/review-izzy-miller-life-on-the-one-and-three-2020/|title=Review: Izzy Miller - Life on the One and Three (2020)|date=April 28, 2020}} ==Other work== On August 23, 2014, Miller and Shane Davis released a collection of rough demo tracks titled ''Izzy & Shane Sing Country Classics''. The album featured Miller and Davis covering songs by artists such as [[Merle Haggard]] and [[George Jones]], among others and was recorded in late 2013. Miller also served as a producer and musician on Davis' debut solo album ''Light Me Another Drink'' (released on January 27, 2015) and his second album, "Shane Davis" (released on February 22, 2016). He continues to work with up-and-coming musicians. He appears in an episode, titled "Smuggler's Blues", of the internet series ''Strings Attached''. The episode was posted on August 11, 2015, and features the cast at the 2015 Dallas International Guitar Festival trying to locate a rare 1960's "Smuggler's" [[Fender Telecaster]].{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wOIei7hjF50|title=Smuggler's Blues|last=Strings Attached|date=August 11, 2015|publisher=|access-date=December 5, 2017|via=YouTube}} In 2020, he appeared in an episode of ''What's It Worth?'', an [[A&E (TV network)|A&E]] show hosted by [[Jeff Foxworthy]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt12841566/fullcredits?ref_=tt_cl_sm#cast|title = What's It Worth? (TV Series 2020– ) - IMDb|website = [[IMDb]]}}{{Cite web|url=https://play.aetv.com/shows/whats-it-worth/season-1/episode-9|title = Vintage Car Superstar | A&E}} ==Personal life== Miller, who is single, currently resides in Huntsville, Alabama. He attended and graduated from [[Sparkman High School]].{{cite web|url=http://www.waff.com/global/story.asp?s=7537593|title=Bryan Family at it again this holiday season... spreading cheer|website=waff.com|access-date=December 5, 2017|archive-date=August 21, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170821002906/http://www.waff.com/global/story.asp?s=7537593|url-status=dead}} He was affected by the [[2011 Super Outbreak]] and released a song about the event, "Miracle Tonight (April 27th, 2011)", on his album ''Who Is That? Nobody''. His home and one of his main guitars, a 1977 Fender Stratocaster, was damaged in the EF-5 tornado that hit [[Harvest, Alabama]].{{cite web|url=http://www.al.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2016/04/sounds_from_the_storm_5_years.html|title=Sounds from the storm: 5 years later, Alabama musicians recall tornadoes' impact|website=al.com|date=April 27, 2016|access-date=December 5, 2017}} He has also toured as part of [[Hank Williams Jr.]]'s road crew as a backline technician.{{cite web|url=http://www.fohonline.com/current-issue/71-showtime/6382-hank-williams-jr.html|title=Hank Williams Jr. - FRONT of HOUSE|first=FOH|last=Staff|date=February 10, 2012|website=fohonline.com|access-date=December 5, 2017|archive-date=August 21, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170821003622/http://www.fohonline.com/current-issue/71-showtime/6382-hank-williams-jr.html|url-status=dead}}{{Cite AV media notes| title = Old School, New Rules| title-link = Old School New Rules| year = 2012| last = Williams, Jr.| first = Hank| type = Liner notes}}{{Cite AV media notes| title = It's About Time| title-link = It's About Time (Hank Williams, Jr. album)| year = 2016| last = Williams, Jr.| first = Hank| type = Liner notes}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.al.com/expo/life-and-culture/g66l-2019/01/6117fcd6521319/meet-a-guitardealing-hank-jr-roadieing-alabama-musicbiz-character.html|title = Meet a guitar-dealing, Hank Jr. Roadie-ing, Alabama music character|date = January 14, 2019}} He revealed on his social media accounts in September 2018 that he was diagnosed with [[trigeminal neuralgia]] the previous year.https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=2307177049311563&id=164050513624238 {{User-generated source|certain=yes|date=March 2022}} Miller collects [[vintage guitar]]s and also works as a vintage guitar dealer when not touring, running a shop called Izzy's Vintage Guitars.{{Cite web |url=https://grinningelkguitarshow.com/mr-izzy-miller-owner-founder-and-overseer-of-izzys-vintage-guitars/ |title=Mr. Izzy Miller- Owner, Founder, and Overseer of Izzy’s Vintage Guitars. |access-date=April 11, 2019 |archive-date=April 11, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190411185501/https://grinningelkguitarshow.com/mr-izzy-miller-owner-founder-and-overseer-of-izzys-vintage-guitars/ |url-status=dead }}{{Cite web|url=https://reverb.com/news/why-are-some-vintage-guitar-parts-so-valuable|title=Why Are Some Vintage Guitar Parts So Valuable?|date=October 7, 2021}} His collection reportedly includes around 100 vintage instruments, including a 1969 [[Fender Custom|Fender Maverick]] and a 1908 [[Gibson Style U]]. ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- !
